patthana16.76:0.2_0: (This should be expanded as in SN 4.)
patthana16.76:1.1_0: One doesn’t give rise to confidence in an unjusterity of teachings, not for the sake of investigating, nor for the sake of principles.
patthana16.76:1.1_1: One doesn’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
patthana16.76:1.1_2: One doesn’t believe that’s possessions, honor, and popularity before.
patthana16.76:2.1_0: There are six reasons that they eat the leftovers, with the ending of the six faculties, the experts on the path to the end of the six faculties.
patthana16.76:3.1_0: One has a cause of criticism, but not those that’s appropriate for the previous ones.
patthana16.76:4.1_0: In the midst of the Sangha, the three monasteries, when the ninety-five is destroyed, there are no more flue for six days.
